feed.title: The Machine Learning for Socio-Technical Systems Lab at University of Rhode Island

entry.title: Congrats to recent graduates Caroline and CJ!
Welcome new undergraduate RAs Linda, Justin, and Aiden
entry.content:
Linda will join our collaboration with the Boykin lab and be developing ecologically valid stimuli for assessing people’s judgements of ML algorithms.

Aiden and Justin will be evaluating performance of fair machine learning models on data with known biases. Marie will continue working on the experiment tools to support this work.
entry.summary: Linda will join our collaboration with the Boykin lab and be developing ecologically valid stimuli for assessing people’s judgements of ML algorithms.Aiden and Justin will be evaluating performance of fair machine learning models on data with known biases. Marie will continue working on the experiment tools to support this work.

entry.title: Surbhi Rathore has passed her MS Thesis Proposal
entry.content: Her thesis is derived from our Task Fairness Project and focuses on feature selection.
entry.summary: Her thesis is derived from our Task Fairness Project and focuses on feature selection.

entry.title: Paper Accepted to 1st ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Ethical Artificial Intelligence
entry.content: Dr. Brown and Surbhi Rathore’s paper “Information Theoretic Framework For Evaluation of Task Level Fairness” was accepted to the 1st ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Ethical Artificial Intelligence! The paper will be presented at the EAI-KDD22 Workshop.
entry.summary: Dr. Brown and Surbhi Rathore’s paper “Information Theoretic Framework For Evaluation of Task Level Fairness” was accepted to the 1st ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Ethical Artificial Intelligence! The paper will be presented at the EAI-KDD22 Workshop.

entry.title: Surbhi Rathore will be the lab’s first PhD Student
entry.content: Surbhi will stay at URI for a PhD, beginning in January 2023 after finishing her MS this semester.
entry.summary: Surbhi will stay at URI for a PhD, beginning in January 2023 after finishing her MS this semester.
